description: HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It defines the structure and content of websites.

topics.title: Introduction to HTML
topics.english: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's the language used for building websites to define content and structure.
topics.hinglish: HTML ka full form HyperText Markup Language hai. Ye website banane ke liye use hoti hai, content aur structure define karti hai.

practice.question: What does HTML stand for?
practice.answer: HyperText Markup Language

practice.question: What is the file extension for HTML documents?
practice.answer: .html

practice.question: What are the main parts of a website?
practice.answer: Head (information for browser) and Body (content for users)

topics.title: HTML Basics & Document Structure
topics.english: Every HTML file has a fixed framework that browsers understand. The standard structure consists of key elements that define what's shown to users and what's hidden information for browsers and search engines.
topics.hinglish: Har HTML file ka ek fixed dhancha hota hai jo browser samajhta hai. Standard structure mein kuch important elements hote hain jo batate hain ki kya user ko dikhega aur kya browser aur search engine ke liye hidden information hai.
examples:
Welcome!

This is my first webpage.

components.name: <!DOCTYPE html>
components.english: This declaration tells the browser that this is an HTML5 document. It must be the very first line of your code.
components.hinglish: Yeh browser ko batata hai ki yeh HTML5 document hai. Yeh aapke code ki sabse pehli line honi chahiye.
components.importance: Essential - without this, browser might not render page correctly

components.name: <html>
components.english: The root element that contains all other HTML elements.
components.hinglish: Yeh root element hai jisme saare HTML elements aate hain.

components.name: <head>
components.english: Contains meta-information about the document that isn't displayed on the page (title, character set, stylesheets, scripts).
components.hinglish: Isme document ki wo information hoti hai jo page par nahi dikhti (title, character set, stylesheets, scripts).
components.note: Browser ke liye important hai, user directly nahi dekhta

components.name: <title>
components.english: Sets the title shown in browser tabs and search engine results.
components.hinglish: Browser ke tab par dikhne wala title aur search engine results mein dikhne wala naam.
components.tip: Keep it short and descriptive (50-60 characters)

components.name: <meta>
components.english: Provides metadata about the HTML document.
components.hinglish: HTML document ke baare mein additional information deta hai.
common_uses: Viewport settings for mobile: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
Page description: <meta name="description" content="Learn HTML basics">

components.name: <body>
components.english: Contains all the visible content of the webpage - text, images, videos, buttons, etc.
components.hinglish: Isme webpage ka saara visible content hota hai - text, images, videos, buttons, etc.
components.tip: Everything you see on a webpage goes inside the body tag

detailed_explanation.example_code:
Welcome to HTML Basics

This is the main content area.

practice.question: Why is <!DOCTYPE html> important?
practice.answer: It tells the browser to use HTML5 standards and ensures proper rendering.

practice.question: What's the difference between <head> and <body>?
practice.answer: <head> contains hidden information for browsers/search engines, <body> contains visible content for users.

practice.question: Where does the page title appear?
practice.answer: In browser tabs, bookmarks, and search engine results.

topics.title: Core Elements (Headings & Paragraphs)
topics.english: Headings define the structure of your content with different levels of importance. Paragraphs organize text into readable blocks. Line breaks and comments help with formatting and documentation.
topics.hinglish: Headings aapke content ka structure define karte hain alag-alag importance levels ke saath. Paragraphs text ko readable blocks mein organize karte hain. Line breaks aur comments formatting aur documentation mein help karte hain.
examples:
Main Title

Section Heading

Sub-section

This is a paragraph of text that explains something in detail.

This is another paragraph.
With a line break in between.

headings.purpose: Create a visual and structural hierarchy

levels.usage: Use only ONE per page for SEO

levels.hinglish: Sub-headings jo importance kam karte jaate hain
levels.tip: Don't skip levels (go from h2 to h3, not h2 to h4)

headings.seo_tip: Search engines use headings to understand page structure. h1 is most important for SEO.

paragraphs.english: Groups related text into blocks with automatic spacing
paragraphs.hinglish: Related text ko blocks mein group karta hai jisme automatically spacing hoti hai

line_breaks.english: Forces a line break within text
line_breaks.hinglish: Text ke beech mein line break force karta hai

comments.english: Text ignored by browser, visible only in source code
comments.hinglish: Yeh text browser ignore karta hai, sirf source code mein dikhta hai

practice.question: How many <h1> tags should a page have?
practice.answer: Only one for best SEO practices.

?

creates a new paragraph block,

practice.question: Who can see HTML comments?
practice.answer: Only developers viewing the source code, not regular website visitors.

topics.title: Formatting Tags
topics.english: Formatting tags change how text appears visually to emphasize importance or change presentation style.
topics.hinglish: Formatting tags text ki visual appearance change karte hain importance emphasize karne ke liye ya presentation style change karne ke liye.
examples:
This is bold and this is also bold.

This is italic and this is emphasized.

This is underlined text.

bold_text.english: Makes text bold for visual styling only
bold_text.hinglish: Text ko sirf visually bold banata hai

bold_text.english: Makes text bold AND indicates strong importance
bold_text.hinglish: Text ko bold banata hai aur strong importance indicate karta hai

italic_text.english: Makes text italic for visual styling only
italic_text.hinglish: Text ko sirf visually italic banata hai

italic_text.english: Makes text italic AND adds emphasis
italic_text.hinglish: Text ko italic banata hai aur emphasis add karta hai

other_formatting.english: Underlines text (use sparingly as links are also underlined)
other_formatting.hinglish: Text ko underline karta hai (kam use karein kyunki links bhi underlined hote hain)

detailed_explanation.key_difference: Visual vs Semantic: <b> vs <strong> and <i> vs <em> look similar visually but have different meanings for screen readers and search engines.

Please read carefully before proceeding.

practice.question: When should you use <strong> instead of <b>?
practice.answer: When the text has actual importance (for screen readers and SEO), not just visual boldness.

practice.question: Why should <u> tag be used carefully?
practice.answer: Because hyperlinks are usually underlined, so underlined text might be confused for links.

practice.question: What's the semantic difference between <i> and <em>?
practice.answer: <i> is just visual styling, <em> adds emphasis that screen readers will pronounce differently.

topics.title: Grouping Elements (Div vs Span)
topics.english: Div and Span are container elements used to group other elements. Div is for block-level grouping, Span is for inline grouping.
topics.hinglish: Div aur Span container elements hain jo dusre elements ko group karne ke liye use hote hain. Div block-level grouping ke liye hai, Span inline grouping ke liye hai.
examples:
This is a Div Section

This paragraph is inside a div.

This is a sentence with a highlighted word.

div_element.english: Division or container - a block-level element
div_element.hinglish: Division ya container - ek block-level element
common_uses: Applying styles to multiple elements at once
Styling part of text within a paragraph
Adding icons or small elements within text

detailed_explanation.example_code:
This is a DIV Container

This whole section is inside a div.

This paragraph contains a highlighted span element for emphasis.

practice.question: When would you use <div> instead of <span>?
practice.answer: When grouping block-level elements or creating layout sections (like header, main content area).

practice.question: Can <span> contain <div> inside it?
practice.answer: No, because span is inline and div is block-level. Block elements cannot go inside inline elements.

practice.question: How do browsers display <div> and <span> by default?
practice.answer: <div> starts on new line with full width, <span> continues in same line taking only needed width.

topics.title: Lists & Links
topics.english: HTML lists organize data into structured formats, while links (hyperlinks) create connections between web pages and resources for navigation.
topics.hinglish: HTML lists data ko structured formats mein organize karti hain, jabki links (hyperlinks) web pages aur resources ke beech connections banate hain navigation ke liye.

unordered_list.english: Unordered List - used when items don't have a specific sequence or order
unordered_list.hinglish: Unordered List - use hoti hai jab items ka koi specific sequence ya order na ho

ordered_list.english: Ordered List - used when items have a specific sequence or step-by-step order
ordered_list.hinglish: Ordered List - use hoti hai jab items ka specific sequence ya step-by-step order ho

definition_list.english: Definition List - used for dictionary-style terms and definitions
definition_list.hinglish: Definition List - dictionary-style terms aur definitions ke liye use hoti hai

anchor_tag.english: Anchor Tag - creates hyperlinks for navigation
anchor_tag.hinglish: Anchor Tag - navigation ke liye hyperlinks banata hai
anchor_tag.purpose: Connects web pages and resources together

href.english: Hypertext Reference - specifies the URL or destination of the link
href.hinglish: Hypertext Reference - link ka URL ya destination specify karta hai

target.english: Specifies where to open the linked document
target.hinglish: Batata hai ki linked document kahan khulega

internal.english: Links to pages within the same website
internal.hinglish: Same website ke andar ke pages ko link karta hai

external.english: Links to pages on different websites
external.hinglish: Different websites ke pages ko link karta hai

phone.english: Opens phone dialer on mobile devices
phone.hinglish: Mobile devices par phone dialer khulta hai

image_link.english: Making an image clickable as a link
image_link.hinglish: Image ko clickable banake link ki tarah use karna

security_tip.english: When using target="_blank", add rel="noopener noreferrer" for security
security_tip.hinglish: Jab target="_blank" use karein, security ke liye rel="noopener noreferrer" add karein
security_tip.reason: Prevents security vulnerabilities with new tabs

practice.question: What's the difference between <ul> and <ol>?
practice.answer: <ul> creates unordered lists with bullet points, <ol> creates ordered lists with numbers.

practice.question: Which attribute is mandatory for anchor <a> tag to work?
practice.answer: href attribute is mandatory to specify the link destination.

practice.question: What does target="_blank" do?
practice.answer: It opens the linked document in a new tab or window.

practice.question: How do you create a link that sends an email?
practice.answer: Use href="mailto:email@example.com" in anchor tag.

practice.question: What security attribute should you add with target="_blank"?
practice.answer: rel="noopener noreferrer" to prevent security vulnerabilities.

topics.title: Media & Images
topics.english: HTML provides tags to embed images, audio, and video content into web pages, making websites more engaging and multimedia-rich.
topics.hinglish: HTML images, audio, aur video content ko web pages mein embed karne ke liye tags provide karta hai, jisse websites zyada engaging aur multimedia-rich ban jaati hain.

img_tag.english: Image tag - embeds images into web pages
img_tag.hinglish: Image tag - images ko web pages mein embed karta hai

src.english: Source - specifies the path or URL of the image
src.hinglish: Source - image ka path ya URL specify karta hai

alt.english: Alternative text - describes the image for accessibility and when image fails to load
alt.hinglish: Alternative text - image ki description deta hai accessibility ke liye aur jab image load na ho
alt.importance: Essential for screen readers, SEO, and user experience

width_height.hinglish: Image ke dimensions pixels mein specify karta hai
width_height.tip: Use only width or height for proportional scaling

figure.english: Container for images, diagrams, or code with optional caption
figure.hinglish: Images, diagrams, ya code ka container optional caption ke saath

figcaption.english: Caption text for content inside <figure> tag
figcaption.hinglish: <figure> tag ke andar ke content ke liye caption text

video_tag.english: Embeds video content into web pages
video_tag.hinglish: Video content ko web pages mein embed karta hai

controls.english: Shows video controls (play, pause, volume, fullscreen)
controls.hinglish: Video controls dikhata hai (play, pause, volume, fullscreen)

autoplay.english: Automatically starts playing video when page loads
autoplay.hinglish: Page load hote hi video automatically play ho jati hai
autoplay.note: Often works only with muted attribute

loop.english: Video restarts automatically when it ends
loop.hinglish: Video khatam hone par automatically restart ho jati hai

muted.hinglish: Video sound ke bina play hoti hai

source_tag.english: Specifies multiple video formats for browser compatibility
source_tag.hinglish: Browser compatibility ke liye multiple video formats specify karta hai

audio_tag.english: Embeds audio content into web pages
audio_tag.hinglish: Audio content ko web pages mein embed karta hai

best_practices.practice: Always use meaningful alt text for images
best_practices.hinglish: Hamesha images ke liye meaningful alt text use karein
best_practices.reason: Helps visually impaired users and improves SEO

best_practices.practice: Optimize image and video file sizes
best_practices.hinglish: Image aur video file sizes optimize karein

best_practices.practice: Use modern formats (WebP for images, MP4 for video)
best_practices.hinglish: Modern formats use karein (images ke liye WebP, video ke liye MP4)

best_practices.practice: Add controls attribute for media playback
best_practices.hinglish: Media playback ke liye controls attribute add karein

practice.question: Why is the alt attribute important for tags?
practice.answer: It provides text description for screen readers, displays when image fails to load, and helps with SEO.

practice.question: What does the controls attribute do in <video> and <audio> tags?
practice.answer: It displays playback controls (play, pause, volume, etc.) for users to interact with media.

practice.question: What is the purpose of <figure> and <figcaption> tags?
practice.answer: <figure> groups media content with caption, <figcaption> provides caption text for that content.

practice.question: Why should you provide multiple <source> tags in <video> element?
practice.answer: To provide different video formats so browsers can choose one they support for better compatibility.

practice.question: What happens if you use only width attribute without height for an image?
practice.answer: The browser automatically calculates and maintains the original aspect ratio of the image.

topics.title: HTML Tables
topics.english: HTML tables are used to display data in a structured format with rows and columns, making complex information easy to read and understand.
topics.hinglish: HTML tables data ko structured format mein display karne ke liye use hote hain rows aur columns ke saath, jisse complex information easily read aur understand ki ja sake.

table_tag.english: Main container for the entire table

table_row.english: Table Row - creates a horizontal row in the table
table_row.hinglish: Table Row - table mein ek horizontal row banata hai

table_header.english: Table Header - defines header cells (usually bold and centered)
table_header.hinglish: Table Header - header cells define karta hai (usually bold aur centered)

table_data.english: Table Data - defines standard data cells
table_data.hinglish: Table Data - standard data cells define karta hai

thead.english: Table Head - groups header content for better structure
thead.hinglish: Table Head - header content ko group karta hai better structure ke liye

tbody.english: Table Body - groups main data content
tbody.hinglish: Table Body - main data content ko group karta hai

tfoot.english: Table Footer - groups footer content (totals, summaries)
tfoot.hinglish: Table Footer - footer content ko group karta hai (totals, summaries)

colspan.english: Merges cells horizontally across multiple columns
colspan.hinglish: Cells ko horizontally merge karta hai multiple columns mein

rowspan.english: Merges cells vertically across multiple rows
rowspan.hinglish: Cells ko vertically merge karta hai multiple rows mein

practice.question: What is the difference between <th> and <td> tags?
practice.answer: <th> defines header cells (bold, centered), <td> defines regular data cells.

practice.question: Why use <thead>, <tbody>, and <tfoot> tags?
practice.answer: They provide semantic structure, improve accessibility, and allow separate styling of table sections.

practice.question: What does colspan="2" do in a table cell?
practice.answer: It makes the cell span across 2 columns horizontally.

practice.question: How many <tr> tags are needed for a table with 5 rows of data?
practice.answer: 5 <tr> tags (plus additional ones for header/footer if used).

topics.title: HTML Forms
topics.english: HTML forms collect user input through various interactive elements, enabling data submission to servers for processing.
topics.hinglish: HTML forms various interactive elements ke through user input collect karte hain, data ko servers par process karne ke liye submit karne ki facility dete hain.

form_container.english: Container element that holds all form controls
form_container.hinglish: Container element jo saare form controls ko hold karta hai

attributes.action: URL where form data is sent
attributes.method: GET (visible in URL) or POST (hidden in request body)

label.english: Provides text description for form controls
label.hinglish: Form controls ke liye text description provide karta hai

password.english: Hides entered characters with dots for security
password.hinglish: Security ke liye entered characters ko dots se hide karta hai

radio.english: Allows single selection from multiple options
radio.hinglish: Multiple options mein se sirf ek selection allow karta hai

checkbox.hinglish: Options mein se multiple selections allow karta hai

submit_button.english: Submits the form data to server
submit_button.hinglish: Form data ko server par submit karta hai

email.english: Validates email format and shows email keyboard on mobile
email.hinglish: Email format validate karta hai aur mobile par email keyboard dikhata hai

range.english: Creates a slider for selecting values
range.hinglish: Values select karne ke liye slider banata hai

number.english: Accepts only numeric input with increment/decrement arrows
number.hinglish: Sirf numeric input accept karta hai increment/decrement arrows ke saath

textarea.english: Multi-line text input for longer content
textarea.hinglish: Longer content ke liye multi-line text input

option.hinglish: <select> element ke andar options define karta hai

button.english: Clickable button (can contain text or images)
button.hinglish: Clickable button (text ya images contain kar sakta hai)

accessibility_tip.english: Always use <label> with for attribute linked to input's id - makes forms accessible and user-friendly
accessibility_tip.hinglish: Hamesha <label> use karein for attribute ke saath jo input ki id se linked ho - forms ko accessible aur user-friendly banata hai

detailed_explanation.example_code: Registration Form

practice.question: What is the purpose of the 'for' attribute in <label> tag?
practice.answer: It links the label to a specific form control using its id, improving accessibility and usability.

practice.question: What's the difference between GET and POST methods in forms?
practice.answer: GET sends data in URL (visible), POST sends in request body (hidden). GET for retrieving data, POST for submitting data.

practice.question: How do radio buttons differ from checkboxes?
practice.answer: Radio buttons allow single selection from options, checkboxes allow multiple selections.

practice.question: Why use HTML5 input types like 'email' and 'date'?
practice.answer: They provide built-in validation, better user interface (keyboard/calendar), and improved mobile experience.

practice.question: What happens if you don't use name attribute in form elements?
practice.answer: The data from that element won't be submitted to the server because name identifies the data.

topics.title: Graphics (Canvas & SVG)
topics.english: HTML5 provides two powerful technologies for graphics: Canvas for pixel-based drawing and animations, and SVG for scalable vector graphics.
topics.hinglish: HTML5 graphics ke liye do powerful technologies provide karta hai: Canvas pixel-based drawing aur animations ke liye, aur SVG scalable vector graphics ke liye.
examples:
<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" fill="blue"/>
</svg>

canvas.english: A rectangular container for drawing graphics using JavaScript
canvas.hinglish: JavaScript use karke graphics draw karne ke liye ek rectangular container
canvas.characteristics: Pixel-based, requires JavaScript to draw, good for animations and games

svg.english: Scalable Vector Graphics - XML-based vector images
svg.hinglish: Scalable Vector Graphics - XML-based vector images
svg.characteristics: Math-based, scalable without quality loss, good for icons and logos

comparison.canvas: Single element, needs JavaScript for interaction

practice.question: What is the main difference between Canvas and SVG?
practice.answer: Canvas is pixel-based and drawn with JavaScript, SVG is vector-based using XML and scales without quality loss.

practice.question: Which technology would you use for creating a company logo?
practice.answer: SVG, because it scales perfectly to any size without losing quality, which is essential for logos.

practice.question: Why is Canvas better for games and animations?
practice.answer: Canvas allows pixel-level manipulation and faster rendering for real-time graphics and animations.

practice.question: What programming language is used with Canvas to draw graphics?
practice.answer: JavaScript is used to draw on Canvas through the Canvas API.

practice.question: Can SVG elements have individual event handlers?
practice.answer: Yes, each SVG element (like circle, rect) can have its own event handlers for interactivity.

topics.title: Modern HTML5 APIs
topics.english: HTML5 provides powerful APIs that enable web applications to have native-like capabilities including data storage, geolocation, and background processing.
topics.hinglish: HTML5 powerful APIs provide karta hai jo web applications ko native-like capabilities deti hain jaise data storage, geolocation, aur background processing.

localStorage.english: Permanent storage that persists even after browser is closed
localStorage.hinglish: Permanent storage jo browser band karne ke baad bhi save rehta hai
localStorage.lifetime: Until explicitly cleared by user or code

sessionStorage.english: Temporary storage that lasts only for the current browser session
sessionStorage.hinglish: Temporary storage jo sirf current browser session tak rehta hai

drag_and_drop.use_cases: File uploaders, task boards, shopping carts

web_workers.benefit: Prevents UI freezing during heavy computations
web_workers.limitations: No DOM access, separate global scope

practice.question: What's the difference between localStorage and sessionStorage?
practice.answer: localStorage persists even after browser closes, sessionStorage lasts only for the current browser session/tab.

practice.question: Why does Geolocation API require user permission?
practice.answer: For privacy and security reasons, as location data is sensitive personal information.

practice.question: What attribute makes an HTML element draggable?
practice.answer: draggable='true' attribute enables drag and drop functionality on an element.

practice.question: What problem do Web Workers solve?
practice.answer: They prevent UI freezing by running heavy JavaScript computations in background threads.

practice.question: Can Web Workers directly access the DOM?
practice.answer: No, Web Workers run in separate threads and cannot directly access or modify the DOM.

topics.title: Metadata & SEO Basics
topics.english: HTML metadata provides essential information about web pages to browsers and search engines, while SEO techniques help improve visibility in search results.
topics.hinglish: HTML metadata web pages ki essential information browsers aur search engines ko provide karti hai, jabki SEO techniques search results mein visibility improve karne mein help karti hain.

charset.english: Defines character encoding for the document
charset.hinglish: Document ke liye character encoding define karta hai
charset.importance: Ensures proper display of special characters and languages

viewport.hinglish: Mobile browsers par layout control karta hai
viewport.purpose: Makes website responsive on different screen sizes

description.english: Provides page summary for search engine results
description.hinglish: Search engine results ke liye page summary provide karta hai
description.seo_importance: Appears in search results under page title

keywords.current_status: Less important for modern SEO, but still used

title_tag.english: Most important SEO element - appears in browser tabs and search results
title_tag.hinglish: Sabse important SEO element - browser tabs aur search results mein dikhta hai

heading_structure.english: Use proper heading hierarchy (h1 > h2 > h3)
heading_structure.hinglish: Proper heading hierarchy use karein (h1 > h2 > h3)
heading_structure.importance: Helps search engines understand content structure

semantic_html.english: Use semantic tags (header, nav, main, article, footer)
semantic_html.hinglish: Semantic tags use karein (header, nav, main, article, footer)
semantic_html.benefits: Better accessibility, SEO, and code readability

alt_text.english: Always provide descriptive alt text for images
alt_text.hinglish: Hamesha images ke liye descriptive alt text provide karein
alt_text.reason: Helps visually impaired users and image search

url_structure.english: Use clean, descriptive URLs with keywords
url_structure.hinglish: Keywords ke saath clean, descriptive URLs use karein

comparison_html_vs_html5.html5: Geolocation, Drag & Drop, Web Workers, etc.

practice.question: Why is the viewport meta tag important?
practice.answer: It makes websites responsive by controlling layout on mobile devices and different screen sizes.

practice.question: Where does the content of <meta name="description"> appear?
practice.answer: In search engine results under the page title, helping users understand page content.

practice.question: What are semantic HTML tags and why are they important for SEO?
practice.answer: Semantic tags (like header, nav, article) describe content meaning, helping search engines understand page structure better.

practice.question: How does HTML5 improve storage compared to older HTML?
practice.answer: HTML5 provides localStorage and sessionStorage (5-10MB) vs cookies (4KB) in older HTML.

practice.question: What's the recommended length for title tags?
practice.answer: 50-60 characters to ensure they display properly in search results and browser tabs.

topics.title: Layout & Element Types
topics.english: HTML elements are categorized by their display behavior and purpose, with block elements forming the structure and inline elements styling content within that structure.
topics.hinglish: HTML elements unke display behavior aur purpose ke hisaab se categorized hote hain, block elements structure banate hain aur inline elements us structure ke andar content ko style karte hain.
examples:
This is a block element
This is inline

block_elements.definition: Start on a new line and take full available width
block_elements.hinglish: Nayi line se shuru hote hain aur poori available width lete hain
characteristics: Create line breaks before and after
Can contain other block and inline elements
Width and height can be set
common_elements: div, header, footer, nav, section, article
h1-h6, p, ul, ol, li, table, form

inline_elements.definition: Flow within text, taking only necessary space

practice.question: What's the main visual difference between block and inline elements?
practice.answer: Block elements start on new line and take full width, inline elements continue in same line taking only needed space.

practice.question: Can inline elements contain block elements?
practice.answer: No, inline elements cannot contain block elements. Block elements can contain both block and inline elements.

practice.question: What is an iframe and when would you use it?
practice.answer: An iframe embeds another HTML page. Used for maps, videos, ads, or third-party content.

practice.question: Why shouldn't tables be used for page layout?
practice.answer: Tables are semantically meant for tabular data. Using them for layout harms accessibility, SEO, and makes responsive design difficult.

practice.question: What attribute is essential for iframe accessibility?
practice.answer: title attribute provides description for screen readers and accessibility tools.

HTML Entities, Symbols & Emojis

1. HTML Entities (Reserved Characters)

These must be encoded to display properly:

< → <
> → >
& → &
© → ©

Practical Example:

<p>5 < 10 is true</p>

practice.question: Why do we need HTML entities for characters like < and >?
practice.answer: Because < and > have special meaning in HTML (they define tags), so entities are needed to display them as regular text.

practice.question: What does the charset meta tag do?
practice.answer: It tells the browser what character encoding to use, ensuring proper display of special characters and international text.

practice.question: How can you display a copyright symbol (©) in HTML?
practice.answer: Using the HTML entity © or the numeric code ©.

practice.question: What happens to spaces in URLs?
practice.answer: Spaces are encoded as %20 in URLs for proper transmission.

practice.question: What are two ways to display emojis in HTML?
practice.answer: 1. Direct copy-paste of emoji, 2. Using HTML entities like 😀 for 😀

Web Accessibility (A11y) Examples

  • Home

1. Semantic HTML - Good vs Bad

✅ GOOD: Using Semantic Elements

<header>
    <h1>Page Title</h1>
    <nav>...</nav>
</header>
<main>
    <article>
        <h2>Article Title</h2>
        <p>Content...</p>
    </article>
</main>
<footer>...</footer>

Screen readers understand the structure clearly.

❌ BAD: Using Only Divs

<div class="header">
    <div class="title">Page Title</div>
    <div class="nav">...</div>
</div>
<div class="content">
    <div class="post">
        <div class="post-title">Article Title</div>
        <div>Content...</div>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="footer">...</div>

Screen readers see everything as generic containers.

practice.question: What are semantic HTML elements and why are they important for accessibility?
practice.answer: Semantic elements (like header, nav, main) describe their meaning/purpose, helping screen readers understand page structure and content.

practice.question: When should you use ARIA attributes?
practice.answer: When HTML semantics aren't sufficient to convey meaning, such as for custom widgets or complex interactions.

practice.question: What's the difference between aria-label and aria-labelledby?
practice.answer: aria-label provides direct text, aria-labelledby references another element's ID that contains the label text.

practice.question: How should alt text for decorative images be handled?
practice.answer: Use empty alt text (alt="") for purely decorative images so screen readers skip them.

practice.question: Why is color contrast important for accessibility?
practice.answer: Sufficient contrast ensures text is readable for people with low vision or color blindness.
